Aniket's Notes

Logistic Regression is used when our target variable is binary. Pi=E(Yi=1∣X)=1/(1+exp(β0+β1D1+...βn+1x))P_i = E(Y_i=1|X) = 1/(1+exp(\beta_0+\beta_1D_1+...\beta_{n+1}x))Pi​=E(Yi​=1∣X)=1/(1+exp(β0​+β1​D1​+...βn+1​x)) ln⁡(Pi1−Pi)=β0+β1D1+...βn+1x\ln\left(\frac{P_i}{1-P_i}\right)=\beta_0+\beta_1D_1+...\beta_{n+1}xln(1−Pi​Pi​​)=β0​+β1​D1​+...βn+1​x $P_i/(1-P_i)$ is called Odds ratio.

Odds ratio={≥1 sucess<1 failure\text{Odds ratio}= \begin{cases} \geq 1 & \text{ sucess}\\ <1 &\text{ failure} \end{cases}Odds ratio={≥1<1​ sucess failure​

Classification tables (Confusion matrix)

  • Sensitivity
  • Specificity
  • ROC | |Observed 1's|Observed 0's| |————-|————|————| |Predicted 1's|TP |FP | |Predicted 0's|FN |TN |

Sensitivity=TPTP+FN\text{Sensitivity}= \frac{TP}{TP+FN}Sensitivity=TP+FNTP​ Specificity=TNTN+FP\text{Specificity}=\frac{TN}{TN+FP}Specificity=TN+FPTN​

Precision=TPTP+FP\text{Precision}=\frac{TP}{TP+FP}Precision=TP+FPTP​ F-Score=2×Recall×PrecisionRecall+Precision\text{F-Score}=\frac{2\times\text{Recall}\times\text{Precision}}{\text{Recall}+\text{Precision}}F-Score=Recall+Precision2×Recall×Precision​

ROC (Receiver Operator Characteristics)
